F30278BF67B743469583CBD86191441E.description: develop and/or select pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in transportation technology, for inclusion in a portfolio (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, sketches, photographs of projects).

42DDF5E62D5E41C8B69DE4484894F528.description: demonstrate an understanding of the work habits that are important for success in the transportation industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability);

ACC5902DE75E4580BE6424072534BF5E.description: demonstrate an understanding of the Essential Skills that are important for success in the transportation industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., finding information, measurement and calculation, problem solving)

220D026EC5AE44B4A6E6743C5415C28F.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the transportation industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

2449C3D78608402BA47C60A838A29080.description: identify a variety of career opportunities in the transportation industry (e.g., apprenticeship/ trade, parts retail, business ownership) and describe the secondary school pathways (i.e., selection of courses, programs, and experiential learning opportunities) that would provide the best preparation for these careers;

3459FF8378154C74B450E56B7A0B6A68.description: identify various sectors and occupational areas within the transportation industry (e.g., sectors: air, sea, rail, road; occupational areas: manufacture of vehicles and/or craft, sales, service);

564DC807711D40DF921A77F7EE9B3AAE.description: Career Opportunities: identify career opportunities in the transportation industry and the education and training required for them

03016B8FFB924A5AB12CE201B1D793D8.description: use protective clothing and equipment (e.g., eye and hearing protection, gloves, breathing apparatus) as required to ensure their own and others’ safety in the work environment.

A01CC237779942D693B652C051582068.description: demonstrate good housekeeping and safety practices in the work environment (e.g., cleaning up spills and leaks, proper disposal of waste, keeping areas clean and clear of obstructions);

A26B5B4A9C9C402A8ADDC97B21A87BB7.description: identify and explain the importance of legislation and regulations related to procedures and operations used in transportation technology facilities (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS], Apprenticeship and Certification Act);

46FB92E44F5E4DB085B9AF44CB676EB4.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and compliance with occupational health and safety regulations and standards in transportation technology;

E00F4CA51AD24E5CB3003F4472A16882.description: explain the pros and cons of various means of transporting people/materials (e.g., by road [bicycle, car, bus, truck], rail, air, water) in terms of economy, safety, convenience, and so on.

80B96DDCCD9B41248BBAFD346F98BA70.description: describe recent technological innovations (e.g., related to performance, comfort, driveability, fuel economy, recycling of parts) in vehicles and/or craft;

EB2C68D11AD54EA9A0430B3C34E35FB0.description: research and report on the development of improved safety features in transportation technology (e.g., airbags, anti-lock brakes);

713D2D7380FE4BE88484008C787EC388.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between various aspects of the transportation industry and society.

23ADA135529E43D3AA0DF141A4F9042B.description: describe the environmental impact of various modes of transportation (e.g., tail-pipe emissions, noise pollution, water contamination and habitat degradation, bird and animal strikes)

A6173EDA5E504F209E8074505E13633A.description: describe the pros and cons of using environmentally friendly products (e.g., biodegradable cleaners) and procedures (e.g., recycling of materials) when servicing and/or maintaining vehicles and/or craft;

B7709EB5A4AD4B0B9FE5AD3D4596F861.description: research and report on ways in which the transportation industry affects the environment and on efforts being made to remedy or reduce harmful effects (e.g., improved production methods, automotive parts recycling), including ways of disposing of waste products (e.g., used oil, used batteries, used paint/thinners);

5B5F49AF66A24D2BB3A3471A5833D3BF.description: Technology and the Environment : demonstrate an understanding of ways in which various aspects of the transportation industry affect the environment and ways in which harmful effects can be remedied or reduced;

7D34C3C94A2C44078DA1E37053321667.description: use proper procedures for winterizing and/or storing vehicles and/or craft (e.g., test antifreeze, drain or stabilize fuel, take rust prevention measures).

C3828DBCE996423BA2C0734984E8AF9D.description: perform exterior and interior surface care procedures (e.g., detailing, washing and waxing, removal of debris from undercarriage) safely and correctly;

8AD46CD772B84F31BBEFF4D123BD06E3.description: Care and Maintenance of Vehicles and/or Craft: follow correct procedures for the preventive maintenance and care of vehicles, aircraft, and/or watercraft.

E088EE791EF340B985D580E3D0046213.description: service steering/control, suspension, brake, electrical, and body system components (e.g., lubricate body hinges [on doors, hood, trunk or hatch], balance tires, check brake fluid level, check vehicle height, charge a discharged battery) safely and correctly.

BCEA7B705913433690949BAF93FA3113.description: perform appropriate measurements related to system components (e.g., tire pressure; chain, cable, and/or belt tension and wear; specific gravity of engine coolant; battery voltage), making any necessary adjustments to meet manufacturers’ specifications;

508D5E30DDAB47D8B99B9AD1E5DFE4E5.description: locate and identify the major components of steering/control, suspension, brake, electrical, and body systems when performing basic service on a vehicle or craft;

F34BADE3BFD047F892F3D3C8BDED20A8.description: Basic Service of Vehicle and/or Craft Systems and Components: perform basic service on various vehicle, aircraft, and/or watercraft systems and components;

A09F1F3E5F9A46F09B1CFFC983F21428.description: perform basic engine repair, demonstrating understanding of the function and operation of engine components (e.g., dismantle and reassemble a small engine safely and correctly, making necessary repairs in the process).

CB97A8C9B69A4A259F85AC6B2EC02B47.description: demonstrate the safe and correct use of various fabrication and repair techniques (e.g., cutting threads, heating, soldering, welding);

380D3177EEBC4FD483B987770FF7FD38.description: demonstrate the correct use of various fastening techniques (e.g., use of fasteners, sealants, bonding agents);

340C9EA008294431A7D857C899477991.description: perform basic maintenance procedures related to powertrains (e.g., engine oil change, basic vehicle/craft inspection, blade or cuttingtool sharpening) safely and correctly;

4843B2DF587A4F77996BEBE38DB343A0.description: use technical and product manuals and/or software programs to identify and locate powertrain components and determine recommended service procedures and maintenance schedules;

7BBBC28DDE6547D29CA84D76432708B3.description: use tools required for basic service tasks related to powertrains (e.g., hand and power tools) correctly and maintain the tools in good working order;

EBA906E8563C4D2386C017FDBB0E99EE.description: Maintenance and Repair Techniques: demonstrate the safe and correct use of a variety of maintenance and repair techniques for servicing powertrain components;

34ABECCFD8894DD89A4AF9D5A2C5408C.description: report on the end result of the project and identify possible improvements.

961DA98194164217BF5FB901F940B64E.description: apply relevant technological concepts (e.g., concepts related to materials, power and energy, mechanisms) appropriately as they work through problem-solving processes related to vehicles or craft;

32DA2A94EFF94DFBA170A75BB299A785.description: use various problem-solving processes and techniques appropriately to solve problems or address challenges related to vehicles or craft;

8A1BB3986CD24A5680334AC116CC3407.description: use a problem-solving process to design and fabricate a project (e.g., a self-propelled vehicle or craft) that demonstrates conversion and use of energy under varying conditions (e.g., application of mechanical advantage, varying torque and speed);

963ECE012B474BACBE23C1BD493A6864.description: Design and Fabrication: use problem-solving processes to design and fabricate a project that converts and uses energy, and to address various problems or challenges related to vehicles or craft;

28A7623A8393442E94025A9339A5A038.description: correctly interpret drawings that depict system components of vehicles and/or craft (e.g., illustrations in parts lists, exploded views, technical drawings)

82552FC018C84EC6ACE2898F45014C46.description: use appropriate terminology for tools and equipment used in connection with vehicles and/or craft (e.g., hand tools: wrenches, socket wrench sets; power tools: air ratchet, drill; equipment: battery chargers, on-board diagnostic [OBD] code readers);

C68DD6C5E86C4C758F30ACE111DDAC65.description: apply appropriate mathematical and/or scientific principles, procedures, and terms and symbols when conducting and/or reporting on work on vehicles and/or craft (e.g., convert measures from US customary/British imperial units to metric units – pounds per square inch [PSI] to kilopascals [kPa], gallons to litres; calculate antifreeze-to-water ratio);

6D252532A77548F9A014DCAA5289C5CA.description: report on work in progress (e.g., complete a work order, parts list, and/or journal) using appropriate documentation;

902DE02DC2EF487F83352963E080EBA1.description: use appropriate resources (e.g., shop manuals, online information) to find information as required for basic maintenance and repair of vehicles and/or craft;

3D52717EEF0F42E6BEC91A76A40C4800.description: Technological and Mathematical Literacy: demonstrate an understanding of the technical and mathematical knowledge and skills required to properly maintain and repair vehicles, aircraft, and/or watercraft.

E39482B3C18D48FBA115FF89B75C8273.description: identify and describe major body, hull, and/or fuselage system components (e.g., fender, keel, fairing).

C843805673E945DE9641100DFAB1D17C.description: identify and describe the function of the electrical system and its components (e.g., battery, fuses, starter);

D2E2053A8D2D434D8D86A9ED50F2433E.description: identify and describe the function of various types of brake systems and their components (e.g., systems: mechanical, hydraulic, electric, pneumatic; components: emergency cable, wheel cylinder, magnet, brake chamber);

BE67734904BF4F6DB0E560B77787BA90.description: identify and describe the function of various types of suspension systems and their components (e.g., systems: coil spring, leaf spring, torsion; components: coil, leaf, torsion bar);

9C46FA2E9C9B47E1A3F8E2F9349B8096.description: identify and describe the function of various types of steering/control systems and their components (e.g., systems: rack and pinion, recirculating ball, fly-by-wire; components: rack, pitman arm);

B4254ECD8BFA4AC6815735C40DD63035.description: Understanding Major Systems and Components: identify and describe the major systems and components of vehicles, aircraft, and/or watercraft;

C27974107C8B4861A17CF00404038744.description: describe the power flow from engine to final drive (e.g., engine to wheels, engine to propeller, engine to track) in various types of drivetrains.

CC7375694FBF41D489E028BF2C666341.description: identify the function and describe the operation of major drivetrain components (e.g., transmission, clutch, differential);

DDAB2D9A45814AAC846DFCDB5B4FC73A.description: describe the various types of drivetrains (e.g., direct, gear to gear, gear and chain, continuously variable systems);

6E10CBB502D24D89802A1A3745C5D546.description: Understanding Drivetrains: identify the major components and describe the function and operation of various types of drivetrains;

D7BB0C2B07454E2BA0949D4C482A4343.description: identify the function and describe the construction and maintenance requirements of an engine fuel system.

B4FC71784185404F957798F8B052B341.description: identify the function and describe the construction and maintenance requirements of an engine lubrication system;

03638CAC489A4A6C90BCE2DABE50678E.description: identify the function and describe the liquid or air pathways and maintenance requirements of various engine cooling systems;

49356EF3500A4AD49C3EDB4C3052D0B3.description: explain how power is produced in the course of an engine cycle (e.g., four-stroke cycle, two-stroke cycle, rotary cycle);

AF5FD695593541B6B0E550E09A89421E.description: identify the function and describe the construction and operation of the major parts of an engine (e.g., piston, crankshaft, connecting rod, camshaft);

7D581B7A1698409E92F88B6B10487E09.description: Understanding Engines: explain how engines work to produce power, and identify the function and explain the maintenance requirements of the cooling, lubrication, and fuel systems;
